  "Broker Comment" : "A CUSTOMER COMPLAINED ABOUT THREE LIMITED PARTNERSHIP INVESTMENTS. HILLIARD, LYONS BOUGHT BACK THE INVESTMENTS AT A COST OF $30,000. NO LAWSUIT OR ARBITRATION WAS EVER FILED. THIS COMPLAINT IS OVER 2 YEARS OLD AND NO LONGER REPORTABLE ON 3/21/86, ATTORNEY FOR CUSTOMER, SENT A WRITTEN COMPLAINT TO HILLIARD-LYONS. CUSTOMER PURCHASED THREE SEPARATE LIMITED PARTNERSHIPS WHICH SHE CLAIMS WERE NOT SUITABLE FOR HER. IN JANUARY,1983, SHE PURCHASED 35 UNITS ($35,000) OF DAMSON OIL AND GAS INCOME FUND, IN SEPTEMBER, 1983, SHE PURCHASED ANOTHER 10 UNITS ($10,000) IN DAMSON, 20 UNITS VALUED AT $500 PER UNIT ($10,000) IN ANGELES INCOME PROPERTIES, AND 5 UNITS VALUED AT $1,000 PER UNIT ($5,000) IN HILLIARD-LYONS THOROUGHBRED PARTNERSHIP II. ON APRIL 5, 1986, HILLIARD-LYONS AGREED TO RESCIND THE PURCHASES MADE IN SEPTEMBER, 1983. MR. COWAN PAID HILLIARD-LYONS AN ADDITIONAL $7,500 TOWARD SETTLEMENT OF THIS COMPLAINT."
